CHARACTER0779705.goal: to use intelligence and analysis to understand the world.

protagonist.description: the character responsible for handling the main problem and the one most in need of change, emotionally.

CHARACTER0779705.strategy: seeking out information and knowledge; self-reflection and understanding thought processes.
CHARACTER0779705.weakness: can study details forever and never act.
CHARACTER0779705.aka: The expert, scholar, detective, advisor, thinker, philosopher, academic, researcher, thinker, planner, professional, mentor, teacher, contemplative.

catalyst.description: the character in a story who causes the protagonist, or main character, to move toward some kind of action or transformation. This character is usually the person that spends the most quality and influential time with the protagonist.

CHARACTER7100213.weakness: crossing over to the dark side, crime
CHARACTER7100213.aka: The rebel, revolutionary, wild man, the misfit, or iconoclast.

CHARACTER2845164.goal: to use intelligence and analysis to understand the world.
CHARACTER2845164.strategy: seeking out information and knowledge; self-reflection and understanding thought processes.
CHARACTER2845164.weakness: can study details forever and never act.
CHARACTER2845164.aka: The expert, scholar, detective, advisor, thinker, philosopher, academic, researcher, thinker, planner, professional, mentor, teacher, contemplative.

temptor.description: the right-hand to the antagonist. The tempter doesn’t need to know the antagonist, but they both stand for the same thing: stopping the protagonist from achieving the protagonist’s goal. The tempter tries to manipulate and convince the protagonist to join the “dark side”. However, in the end, the tempter can change his/her mind and realize the benefit of joining the good guys.

CHARACTER8470756.desire: understanding the fundamental laws of the universe
CHARACTER8470756.strategy: develop a vision and live by it
CHARACTER8470756.aka: The visionary, catalyst, inventor, charismatic leader, shaman, healer, medicine man.

CHARACTER3462172.goal: to experience a better, more authentic, more fulfilling life
CHARACTER3462172.desire: the freedom to find out who you are through exploring the world
CHARACTER3462172.biggest fear: getting trapped, conformity, and inner emptiness
CHARACTER3462172.strategy: journey, seeking out and experiencing new things, escape from boredom
CHARACTER3462172.talent: autonomy, ambition, being true to one's soul
CHARACTER3462172.aka: The seeker, iconoclast, wanderer, individualist, pilgrim.

CHARACTER4246050.goal: create a prosperous, successful family or community

emotional.description: this character acts according to their gut and lets motions fuel decisions. Impulsive. Reactive. Sometimes the emotional character is right and succeeds in ways that a thinking person would never have even tried, but sometimes the character finds trouble by not thinking before jumping.

CHARACTER4246050.aka: The boss, leader, aristocrat, king, queen, politician, role model, manager or administrator.

CHARACTER5441030.goal: create a prosperous, successful family or community

mentor.description: the protagonist’s conscience and the prevailing side to the thematic argument. The mentor voices or represents the lesson that must be learned by the protagonist in order to change for the better and achieve the goal. (Note: Be mindful of creating a mentor who is as perfect and principled as humans can be, for doing so will make the character seem inhuman. Instead, let the mentor be flawed, like all us humans.)

CHARACTER5441030.aka: The boss, leader, aristocrat, king, queen, politician, role model, manager or administrator.

logical.description: the rational thinker who plans things out, shoots for logical solutions and gives reasonable, matter-of-fact answers to questions. However, sometimes the head needs to listen to the heart to work at its best.

CHARACTER5934224.greatest fear: to be punished for doing something bad or wrong
CHARACTER5934224.weakness: their naive innocence can be boring or lack realism
CHARACTER5934224.aka: The utopian, the traditionalist, naive, mystic, saint, romantic, dreamer.

CHARACTER2040924.goal: to have a great time and lighten up the world

skeptic.description: the lone objector. The skeptic does not believe in the theme nor in the importance of achieving the protagonist’s goal. Without loyalties, the skeptic is on his/her own path. The skeptic may like the protagonist and want the protagonist to succeed but not at the cost of the skeptic’s goals. However, the skeptic may have a change of heart by the end of the story.

CHARACTER2040924.desire: to live in the moment with full enjoyment
CHARACTER2040924.aka: The fool, trickster, joker, practical joker or comedian.

antagonist.description: the primary bad guy. The character that opposes the protagonist outright on all counts, physically and emotionally.

CHARACTER2229947.greatest fear: to be punished for doing something bad or wrong
CHARACTER2229947.weakness: their naive innocence can be boring or lack realism
CHARACTER2229947.aka: The utopian, the traditionalist, naive, mystic, saint, romantic, dreamer.

foil.description: a supporting character who has a contrasting personality and set of values to the protaganist. Putting the foil and main character in close proximity helps draw readers’ attention to the latter’s attributes.

CHARACTER8506136.greatest fear: to be left out or to stand out from the crowd
CHARACTER8506136.strategy: to develop ordinary solid virtues, be down to earth, the common touch
CHARACTER8506136.weakness: losing one's own self in an effort to blend in or for the sake of superficial relationships
CHARACTER8506136.aka: The good old boy, everyman, the person next door, the realist, the solid citizen, the good neighbour, the silent majority.

protagonist.description: the character responsible for handling the main problem and the one most in need of change, emotionally.

antagonist.description: the primary bad guy. The character that opposes the protagonist outright on all counts, physically and emotionally.

mentor.description: the protagonist’s conscience and the prevailing side to the thematic argument. The mentor voices or represents the lesson that must be learned by the protagonist in order to change for the better and achieve the goal. (Note: Be mindful of creating a mentor who is as perfect and principled as humans can be, for doing so will make the character seem inhuman. Instead, let the mentor be flawed, like all us humans.)

temptor.description: the right-hand to the antagonist. The tempter doesn’t need to know the antagonist, but they both stand for the same thing: stopping the protagonist from achieving the protagonist’s goal. The tempter tries to manipulate and convince the protagonist to join the “dark side”. However, in the end, the tempter can change his/her mind and realize the benefit of joining the good guys.

skeptic.description: the lone objector. The skeptic does not believe in the theme nor in the importance of achieving the protagonist’s goal. Without loyalties, the skeptic is on his/her own path. The skeptic may like the protagonist and want the protagonist to succeed but not at the cost of the skeptic’s goals. However, the skeptic may have a change of heart by the end of the story.

emotional.description: this character acts according to their gut and lets motions fuel decisions. Impulsive. Reactive. Sometimes the emotional character is right and succeeds in ways that a thinking person would never have even tried, but sometimes the character finds trouble by not thinking before jumping.

logical.description: the rational thinker who plans things out, shoots for logical solutions and gives reasonable, matter-of-fact answers to questions. However, sometimes the head needs to listen to the heart to work at its best.

foil.description: a supporting character who has a contrasting personality and set of values to the protaganist. Putting the foil and main character in close proximity helps draw readers’ attention to the latter’s attributes.

catalyst.description: the character in a story who causes the protagonist, or main character, to move toward some kind of action or transformation. This character is usually the person that spends the most quality and influential time with the protagonist.

goal.description: character wants something on the scene level that will ultimately help him reach his overall plot goal—and he tries to get it

conflict.description: character is met with an obstacle to obtaining his goal

outcome.description: usually disastrous, in the sense that the character does not achieve the goal or achieves only part of it

passage_pair.description: Passage pairs are made up of a scene and a sequel.

delemma.description: character must figure out  how to overcome the new complications and still move forward toward his main plot goal

decision.description: character decides upon a new scene goal to cope with the new complications and move forward toward the main plot goal in a—hopefully—more effective way
